thread.title: Barcelona and Monaco lead scoring charts with 100 goals | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Barcelona and Monaco lead scoring charts with 100 goals | Daily Mail Online

author: Andy Warren For Mailonline
title: Barcelona and Monaco lead scoring charts with 100 goals | Daily Mail Online
text: 33 Neymar, Lionel Messi and Luis Suarez have scored 62 of Barcelona's 100 goals this season For Barcelona, the triumvirate of Lionel Messi, Neymar and Luis Suarez have netted 62 of their 100 goals. Arsenal are the highest scoring English side with 83 goals from 35 games with the two Manchester clubs, City and United, sixth and eighth respectively having competed in four competitions so far this season. The Gunners are tied with Liverpool in terms of Premier League goals, with 52, but Arsene Wenger's side's participation in Europe this season has allowed them to pull away. Klopp's reds, who are 13th on the list, have struck 66 times in their 33 games. Cristiano Ronaldo has contributed 20 of the 98 goals scored by Real Madrid in all competitions Arsenal, led by Alexis Sanchez, are the leading English side when it comes to goals this season Chelsea and Liverpool are the only teams to have made the list, not competing in Europe this season. The Premier League contributes six teams to the top 20, with Spain providing five, Italy four, France three and Germany just two. Despite selling leading scorer Gonzalo Higuain to Juventus in the summer, Napoli are Serie A's leading representatives having managed 70 goals from just 31 games, scoring a goal more than Manchester United having played seven fewer matches. Napoli, now led by Dries Mertens, top the Italian charts despite Gonzalo Higuain's departure Juventus top the Italian standings but have scored less goals than both Napoli and Roma, with Fiorentina making the list of top scorers despite sitting seventh in their domestic league. Celta Vigo are another side well off the pace to have made the list, sitting 20th in the European scoring charts despite being only 10th in the Spanish top flight. The combined might of the Europa League and the Copa del Rey has contributed 20 of their 53 goals. Paris Saint-Germain are still finding the net at an impressive rate despite the departure of Zlatan Ibrahimovic, having netted 82 times from their 35 matches so far this season. Edinson Cavani is the leading contributor, with 30. The PSG players mob Edinson Cavani, who has picked up where Zlatan Ibrahimovic left off RELATED ARTICLES
